Detailed Description

Frame creation and manipulation.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum cvl_format_t

Format of a frame.

Enumerator:
CVL_LUM  Luminance values.
CVL_XYZ  CIE XYZ color space.
CVL_RGB  RGB color space.
CVL_HSL  HSL color space. H = 0/360 is red, 120/360 is green, and 240/360 is blue.
CVL_UNKNOWN  Unspecified or unknown color space.

enum cvl_type_t

Type of a frame.

Enumerator:
CVL_UINT8  8bit unsigned integer.
CVL_FLOAT  32bit IEEE floats.

enum cvl_storage_t

Storage area of a frame. Note that both memory and texture representations may be valid at the same time.

Enumerator:
CVL_MEM  In-memory representation.
CVL_TEXTURE  Texture representation.

Function Documentation

cvl_frame_t* cvl_frame_new ( int  width,
int  height,
int  channels,
cvl_format_t  format,
cvl_type_t  type,
cvl_storage_t  storage 
)

Parameters:
width Frame width.
height Frame height.
channels Number of channels.
format Frame format.
type Frame type.
storage Frame storage.
Creates a new frame with the given width and height. Each pixel will consist of 1-4 values (depending on the channels parameter) of the given type. The pixels will be interpreted in the given format. Note that if the number of channels is less than what would be expected for the given format, the results might be unexpected. A larger number of channels is ok. The initial storage space for the frame can be chosen with the storage parameter.

cvl_frame_t* cvl_frame_new_tpl ( const cvl_frame_t *  frame  ) 

Parameters:
frame A frame.
Creates a new frame with the same dimensions, type, channels, and format as the frame frame. Frame tags are not copied.

void cvl_frame_free ( cvl_frame_t *  frame  ) 

Parameters:
frame The frame.
Frees the frame and its associated resources.

const char* cvl_frame_channel_name ( const cvl_frame_t *  frame,
int  channel 
)

Parameters:
frame The frame.
channel The channel.
Returns:
The name of the given channel.
Returns the name of the given channel. The channel must exist.
The names for known frame formats are single letters, for example "R", "G", and "B" for CVL_RGB. For CVL_LUM, the name of the channel is "Y". If the frame format is CVL_UNKNOWN, the channel names can be arbitrary strings or NULL if there is no associated name.

void cvl_frame_set_channel_name ( cvl_frame_t *  frame,
int  channel,
const char *  name 
)

Parameters:
frame The frame.
channel The channel.
name The name of the given channel.
Sets the name of the given channel of the frame frame. The channel must exist. Settings channel names is only allowed for frames of format CVL_UNKNOWN. A name that is NULL deletes a previous name.

Converts the frame frame to the new type type.

void* cvl_frame_pointer ( cvl_frame_t *  frame  ) 

Parameters:
frame The frame.
Returns:
A pointer to the memory representation.
Returns a pointer to the memory representation of the frame. The pointer is only valid until the next call to a CVL function. For CVL_LUM frames, the returned data is in GL_LUMINANCE format. For CVL_UNKNOWN, it is GL_RGBA. For other formats, it is GL_RGB.
Note that you will never get a two-channel memory representation, and that you will always get a four-channel representation for CVL_UNKNOWN frames!

GLuint cvl_frame_texture ( cvl_frame_t *  frame  ) 

Parameters:
frame The frame.
Returns:
The frame texture.
Returns the GL texture of the frame. The texture handle is only valid until the next call to a CVL function.

void cvl_transform ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
Renders the frame src 1:1 into the frame dst. This is used for many kinds of frame manipulations that can be done with a fragment shader. After activating the GL program with the chosen fragment shader, this function does the necessary quad rendering.

void cvl_transform_multi ( cvl_frame_t **  dsts,
int  ndsts,
cvl_frame_t **  srcs,
int  nsrcs,
const char *  textures_name 
)

Parameters:
dsts The destination frames.
ndsts The number of destination frames.
srcs The source frames.
nsrcs The number of source frames.
textures_name Name of the textures uniform variable array.
Renders the frames srcs 1:1 into the frames dsts, using Multitexturing and Multiple Render Targets.
The active program must be able to handle this situation. The name of the uniform variable array that stores the textures must be given in textures_names, so that this function can fill the right values in.
See also cvl_frame_transform().
